title: Medical Prefixes: The Beginning of Words
description: Prefixes are word parts added to the beginning of a root word to modify its meaning. Learning common medical prefixes helps you understand unfamiliar terms.

introduction.level1: A prefix is a small word part that goes at the start of a medical word. It changes the meaning of the word. For example, 'pre-' means 'before,' so 'prenatal' means 'before birth.'
introduction.level2: Medical prefixes are attached to the beginning of root words to modify their meaning. Understanding common prefixes allows you to decode many medical terms you encounter.
introduction.level3: Prefixes in medical terminology serve as modifiers that attach to the beginning of root words. They typically indicate location, time, quantity, or negation. Mastering common prefixes provides a foundation for understanding complex medical vocabulary.

definitions.level2: Indicates the absence or lack of something
definitions.level3: Denotes absence, deficiency, or negation of the root term
definitions.level4: Greek-derived prefix indicating privation or absence of the quality or condition described by the root
definitions.level5: Privative prefix of Greek origin (alpha privative) indicating absence, lack, or negation; 'an-' variant used before vowels and 'h'

examples.meaning: without breathing; temporary stop in breathing

prefixes.clinicalContext: Common in describing conditions where something normal is absent, such as 'atypical' (not typical), 'arrhythmia' (without regular rhythm), or 'afebrile' (without fever).

definitions.level2: Works against or opposes something
definitions.level3: Indicates opposition to or counteraction of something
definitions.level4: Denotes antagonism, opposition, or counteraction to the root term
definitions.level5: Greek-derived prefix indicating opposition, counteraction, or prophylaxis against a condition or agent

prefixes.clinicalContext: Extensively used in pharmacology to describe medications that work against diseases, symptoms, or physiological processes.

categories.name: Location and Position
categories.description: Prefixes that describe where something is located

definitions.level2: Located on the surface or above something
definitions.level3: Indicates a position upon, above, or superficial to another structure
definitions.level4: Denotes a superficial or superior anatomical position relative to the root structure
definitions.level5: Greek-derived prefix indicating a position upon, over, or superficial to the root anatomical structure

definitions.level2: Below normal or underneath something
definitions.level3: Indicates a position below, beneath, or a deficiency of something
definitions.level4: Denotes either an anatomical position inferior to a structure or a physiological state below normal parameters
definitions.level5: Greek-derived prefix with dual meaning: anatomically indicates inferior position; physiologically indicates subnormal function or deficiency

definitions.level2: More than normal or above what is expected
definitions.level3: Indicates excess, above normal limits, or hyperfunction
definitions.level4: Denotes a state above normal physiological parameters or excessive activity/quantity
definitions.level5: Greek-derived prefix indicating supranormal function, quantity, or position; antonym of hypo-

definitions.level2: Located underneath or less than something
definitions.level3: Indicates a position beneath or inferior to another structure
definitions.level4: Denotes anatomical position inferior or deep to a reference structure
definitions.level5: Latin-derived prefix indicating inferior anatomical position or reduced degree of a quality

definitions.level2: Located above or superior to something
definitions.level3: Indicates a position above or superior to another structure
definitions.level4: Denotes anatomical position superior to a reference structure
definitions.level5: Latin-derived prefix indicating superior anatomical position or excess degree

definitions.level2: Located below or inferior to something
definitions.level3: Indicates a position below or inferior to another structure
definitions.level4: Denotes anatomical position inferior to a reference structure
definitions.level5: Latin-derived prefix indicating inferior anatomical position

definitions.level2: Located inside or occurring within something
definitions.level3: Indicates position or occurrence within a structure or system
definitions.level4: Denotes location or administration within an anatomical structure or organ
definitions.level5: Latin-derived prefix indicating location within or administration into the interior of a structure

definitions.level2: Located outside or external to something
definitions.level3: Indicates position or occurrence outside a structure or system
definitions.level4: Denotes location external to an anatomical structure or beyond normal limits
definitions.level5: Latin-derived prefix indicating position outside or external to the root structure

definitions.level2: Located around or encircling something
definitions.level3: Indicates position around or encircling a structure
definitions.level4: Denotes circumferential location around an anatomical structure
definitions.level5: Greek-derived prefix indicating circumferential or surrounding position relative to the root structure

examples.meaning: the time around surgery (before, during, after)

definitions.level2: Located on the inside or inner surface
definitions.level3: Indicates the inner portion or lining of a structure
definitions.level4: Denotes the interior or inner aspect of an anatomical structure
definitions.level5: Greek-derived prefix indicating the innermost aspect or internal location within a structure

examples.meaning: the inner lining of the heart
looking inside the body with a camera

definitions.level2: Located on the outside or outer surface
definitions.level3: Indicates the outer portion or external aspect of a structure
definitions.level4: Denotes the exterior or outer aspect of an anatomical structure
definitions.level5: Greek-derived prefix indicating the outermost aspect or external location

examples.meaning: in an abnormal location (outside the normal place)

categories.name: Time and Sequence
categories.description: Prefixes that describe when something happens

definitions.level2: Occurring before an event or procedure
definitions.level3: Indicates temporal or positional precedence
definitions.level4: Denotes temporal precedence or anatomical anterior position
definitions.level5: Latin-derived prefix indicating temporal precedence or anterior anatomical position

definitions.level2: Occurring after an event or procedure
definitions.level3: Indicates temporal or positional succession
definitions.level4: Denotes temporal succession or anatomical posterior position
definitions.level5: Latin-derived prefix indicating temporal succession or posterior anatomical position

definitions.level2: Refers to something new or recently developed
definitions.level3: Indicates new formation or recent origin
definitions.level4: Denotes new growth, formation, or recent origin of a structure or condition
definitions.level5: Greek-derived prefix indicating new formation or neoplastic origin

categories.name: Size and Quantity
categories.description: Prefixes that describe amount or size

definitions.level2: Larger than normal size
definitions.level3: Indicates abnormally large size of a structure or cell
definitions.level4: Denotes pathologically or abnormally large dimensions
definitions.level5: Greek-derived prefix indicating macroscopic or abnormally large size

examples.meaning: an abnormally large red blood cell

definitions.level2: Smaller than normal or microscopic
definitions.level3: Indicates abnormally small size or microscopic dimensions
definitions.level4: Denotes pathologically small dimensions or microscopic scale
definitions.level5: Greek-derived prefix indicating microscopic dimensions or abnormally small size

examples.meaning: an abnormally small red blood cell

definitions.level2: Multiple or numerous
definitions.level3: Indicates the presence of many or excessive quantity
definitions.level4: Denotes multiplicity or pathological increase in number
definitions.level5: Greek-derived prefix indicating plurality or abnormally increased number

definitions.level2: Less than normal or insufficient
definitions.level3: Indicates deficiency or abnormally decreased quantity
definitions.level4: Denotes pathological decrease in number or amount
definitions.level5: Greek-derived prefix indicating paucity or abnormally decreased number

definitions.level2: Only one of something
definitions.level3: Indicates a single instance or unilateral involvement
definitions.level4: Denotes singular occurrence or unilateral pathology
definitions.level5: Latin (uni-) or Greek (mono-) derived prefix indicating singular or unilateral nature

examples.meaning: a type of white blood cell with one nucleus

definitions.level2: Two of something or on both sides
definitions.level3: Indicates two instances or bilateral involvement
definitions.level4: Denotes dual occurrence or bilateral pathology
definitions.level5: Latin-derived prefix indicating bilateral or dual nature

definitions.level2: Involving four parts or areas
definitions.level3: Indicates four structures or all four limbs
definitions.level4: Denotes involvement of four anatomical regions, typically all extremities
definitions.level5: Latin-derived prefix indicating four anatomical structures or regions

definitions.level2: One half of something
definitions.level3: Indicates one half or one side of a structure
definitions.level4: Denotes involvement of half of a structure, typically one side
definitions.level5: Greek-derived prefix indicating hemilateral or half involvement

examples.meaning: paralysis of one side of the body

categories.name: Direction and Movement
categories.description: Prefixes that describe direction or movement

definitions.level2: Moving away from a central point
definitions.level3: Indicates movement away from the midline or center
definitions.level4: Denotes movement or orientation away from the anatomical midline
definitions.level5: Latin-derived prefix indicating movement or direction away from the central axis

examples.meaning: movement away from the body's midline

definitions.level2: Moving toward a central point
definitions.level3: Indicates movement toward the midline or center
definitions.level4: Denotes movement or orientation toward the anatomical midline
definitions.level5: Latin-derived prefix indicating movement or direction toward the central axis

definitions.level2: Going through or crossing something
definitions.level3: Indicates passage through or across a structure
definitions.level4: Denotes traversing through an anatomical structure
definitions.level5: Latin-derived prefix indicating passage through or across anatomical planes or structures

definitions.level2: Located behind or moving backward
definitions.level3: Indicates posterior position or backward direction
definitions.level4: Denotes anatomical position posterior to or backward movement
definitions.level5: Latin-derived prefix indicating posterior anatomical position or retrograde direction

definitions.level2: Refers to a bluish color or discoloration
definitions.level3: Indicates blue discoloration, typically from low oxygen
definitions.level4: Denotes blue discoloration associated with deoxygenated hemoglobin
definitions.level5: Greek-derived prefix indicating blue discoloration from reduced hemoglobin or other causes

examples.meaning: bluish discoloration of skin from lack of oxygen

definitions.level2: Refers to a reddish color
definitions.level3: Indicates red color or red blood cells
definitions.level4: Denotes erythrocytes (red blood cells) or red discoloration
definitions.level5: Greek-derived prefix indicating erythrocyte-related pathology or red coloration

definitions.level2: Refers to a white color or white blood cells
definitions.level3: Indicates white color or white blood cells
definitions.level4: Denotes leukocytes (white blood cells) or white discoloration
definitions.level5: Greek-derived prefix indicating leukocyte-related pathology or white coloration

definitions.level2: Refers to a black or dark color
definitions.level3: Indicates dark pigmentation or melanin
definitions.level4: Denotes melanin-related structures or dark pigmentation
definitions.level5: Greek-derived prefix indicating melanin or abnormal dark pigmentation

examples.meaning: a cancer of pigmented skin cells

categories.name: Speed and Frequency
categories.description: Prefixes that describe rate or speed

definitions.level2: Faster than normal
definitions.level3: Indicates abnormally fast rate or rhythm
definitions.level4: Denotes pathologically increased rate or frequency
definitions.level5: Greek-derived prefix indicating abnormally rapid rate of a physiological process

examples.meaning: fast heart rate (over 100 beats per minute)

definitions.level2: Slower than normal
definitions.level3: Indicates abnormally slow rate or rhythm
definitions.level4: Denotes pathologically decreased rate or frequency
definitions.level5: Greek-derived prefix indicating abnormally slow rate of a physiological process

examples.meaning: slow heart rate (under 60 beats per minute)

categories.name: Quality and Condition
categories.description: Prefixes that describe good, bad, or other conditions

definitions.level2: Abnormal or painful function
definitions.level3: Indicates difficult, painful, or abnormal function
definitions.level4: Denotes disordered or impaired function of a process
definitions.level5: Greek-derived prefix indicating impaired, painful, or abnormal physiological function

definitions.level2: Normal or healthy function
definitions.level3: Indicates normal or healthy function
definitions.level4: Denotes normal physiological function or state
definitions.level5: Greek-derived prefix indicating normal or healthy physiological function

definitions.level2: Resembles but is not the real thing
definitions.level3: Indicates a false or deceptive resemblance
definitions.level4: Denotes a condition that mimics another but has different etiology
definitions.level5: Greek-derived prefix indicating phenotypic mimicry without true pathological identity

examples.meaning: a fluid collection that resembles a cyst but lacks a true cyst wall

definitions.level2: Abnormal or improper function
definitions.level3: Indicates abnormal, inadequate, or poor function
definitions.level4: Denotes pathological or defective function
definitions.level5: Latin-derived prefix indicating inadequate or abnormal function or development

practiceExercises.instruction: Break down these terms into their prefix and root components:
Match the prefix to its meaning:

keyTakeaways: Prefixes are added to the beginning of root words to modify meaning
Many prefixes come in opposite pairs (hypo-/hyper-, tachy-/brady-, pre-/post-)
Learning prefixes helps you decode unfamiliar medical terms
When in doubt about a term, ask your healthcare provider to explain
